article_title: Hospital billing, exec comp: These fixes are bogus
article_text:
Hospital CEO salaries are not a significant factor in health costs

Big money goes to total employee wages and benefits, drugs, technology

Average compensation for hospital CEO is less than one-tenth of one percent of a hospital’s budget

article_metadata.news-keywords: John G. Taylor, hospitals, Sacramento, Affordable Care Act, JT Communications Co.
article_metadata.description: Twin thorns of health care costs and executive compensation are again being furiously wiggled in Sacramento by lawmakers, community activists and labor organizers using legislation and ballot initiatives. It’s the usual carrot and stick. Labor leaders usually want access to additional hospital members and their dues. Pouncing on hospital complexity is a reliable weapon.
